name: RestoreBackup
description:
Restore collections from a specified backup.

Initiates the restoration of collections from a backup stored on a designated backend. Ensure the target cluster has identical node configurations as the source cluster, and that the collections do not already exist on the target.

parameters.name: backup_backend_storage
parameters.description: Specifies the backend storage system where the backup resides, such as `filesystem`, `gcs`, `s3`, or `azure`.

value_schema.description: Specifies the backend storage system where the backup resides (e.g., `filesystem`, `gcs`, `s3`, `azure`).

parameters.name: backup_identifier
parameters.description: The unique identifier for the backup to restore. It must be URL-safe and compatible with filesystem paths, using only lowercase letters, numbers, underscores, and minus characters.

value_schema.description: The unique identifier of the backup to restore from. Must be URL-safe and compatible with filesystem paths (only lowercase, numbers, underscore, minus characters allowed).

parameters.name: restore_request_details
parameters.description: Details of the restore request, including collections to include or exclude, node mapping, and configurations like CPU usage.

Endpoint.description: name of the endpoint, e.g. s3.amazonaws.com

Bucket.description: Name of the bucket, container, volume, etc

CPUPercentage.description: Desired CPU core utilization ranging from 1%-80%

include.description: List of collections (classes) to include in the backup restoration process.

exclude.description: List of collections (classes) to exclude from the backup restoration process.

node_mapping.description: Allows overriding the node names stored in the backup with different ones. Useful when restoring backups to a different environment.

overwriteAlias.description: Allows ovewriting the collection alias if there is a conflict

value_schema.description: Details of the restore request, including collections to include or exclude and node mapping if necessary.

metadata.description: Tools that enable LLMs to interact directly with the weaviate API.

parameters.name: backend
parameters.description: Specifies the backend storage system where the backup resides (e.g., `filesystem`, `gcs`, `s3`, `azure`).

value_schema.description: Specifies the backend storage system where the backup resides (e.g., `filesystem`, `gcs`, `s3`, `azure`).

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the backup to restore from. Must be URL-safe and compatible with filesystem paths (only lowercase, numbers, underscore, minus characters allowed).

value_schema.description: The unique identifier of the backup to restore from. Must be URL-safe and compatible with filesystem paths (only lowercase, numbers, underscore, minus characters allowed).

parameters.name: requestBody
parameters.description: Details of the restore request, including collections to include or exclude and node mapping if necessary.

Endpoint.description: name of the endpoint, e.g. s3.amazonaws.com

Bucket.description: Name of the bucket, container, volume, etc

CPUPercentage.description: Desired CPU core utilization ranging from 1%-80%

include.description: List of collections (classes) to include in the backup restoration process.

exclude.description: List of collections (classes) to exclude from the backup restoration process.

node_mapping.description: Allows overriding the node names stored in the backup with different ones. Useful when restoring backups to a different environment.

overwriteAlias.description: Allows ovewriting the collection alias if there is a conflict

value_schema.description: Details of the restore request, including collections to include or exclude and node mapping if necessary.
